title: Language and Literacy
subject: Core Knowledge® Sequence: Content and Skill Guidelines for Preschool

document.title: Core Knowledge® Sequence Content and Skill Guidelines for Preschool

54F63A4E592E4F6F818E70D973FA57AB.description: Write one’s first name, using uppercase and lowercase letters appropriately.

E0203616D1F5498DA1915EB27E008493.description:
Trace and then draw independently the outlines of
 geometric shapes and irregular figures.

023B82C540E84B398F31CB4365B6AE3A.description:
Hold a writing instrument correctly between the
 thumb and index finger, resting it against the
 middle finger.

C45B090101A9431A98854C9CA0CD70A7.description:
Draw horizontal and vertical lines between two
 end points.

6ABB0A93ED8043A4A05A454B136F30C1.description:
Draw and use as motifs: horizontal line
 vertical line
 diagonal line
 zigzag line
 circle
 spiral
 moon
 cross cane
 hook
 bowl
 bridge
 wave
 x
 star

09B0C36713034C01A3CB6269E0370775.description:
Draw and use as motifs: horizontal line

 vertical line
 point
 spiral

8CBE1DD566054DB0814AAA25BBEB119F.description: Color a simple drawing, staying within the lines.

11E01F51B06D454E81F00F6D87CCD304.description:
Produce written marks on both horizontal and
 vertical surfaces.

87F474FD8FE245D3903E6A8566CCD6EA.description: Perform activities requiring small muscle control.

8DC042694F3E485BA3D7692692D9F82D.description: GOAL: DEVELOP THE FINE MOTOR SKILLS AND STROKES USED IN WRITING

FE02081399324058B53F0BF57BD87FCF.description:
Give the sounds of at least three letters of the alphabet, especially those in the child’s own
 name.

AC0B0B32AEC942B2AFB4D9A2FDC99BB4.description: Given a word, provide a rhyming word.

AFA3819E9DFA4E5CB00CCF461F738BFC.description: Identify at least ten letters of the alphabet by name, especially those in the child’s first name.

BED1FDDA66D844CE9031D622490754C0.description: Indicate the number of phonemes (one to three) heard in a real or nonsense word.

FF5308CEB8554D50B87E6F9F300C79DE.description: Give the beginning sound of a spoken word.

81B7B60FE93A4AB7A2EAA10C9E6231DF.description:
Given a sound and a choice of two words,
 choose the word that begins with the given
 sound.

3042D857345E4DC191E01AD795891D12.description: Blend two spoken syllables, saying the whole word.

6EC6184EDB1048F6B283A0C8E12EC36F.description:
Blend spoken parts of a compound word, saying
 a whole word.

6B5474AE0ECC44D4B86A87553740151E.description: Segment a spoken sentence into separate, distinct words.

500080B0EA2949C89C583FC3B06654C6.description:
Make beginning efforts to use invented, phonetic
 spelling to communicate in writing.

C04E7ED8145046EF8398FA6D5DEADFDB.description: Point to words as distinct units on a page of print.

F0EAB67D6612462A9E1B30C9E652F2AC.description:
Associate spoken and written language by
 matching written word labels with spoken words.

4C9A11FE540E4C72A3685E0D64D4093B.description:
Read the first names of other classmates or family
 members.

6BF014025B4D4D808F735996102D03B4.description: Write one’s first name, using uppercase and lowercase letters appropriately.

C4B0A2B9FF0A4C50AEE0EE06AF673125.description: Recognize the written form of one’s first name.

A728CA86A07B4CACA191784466BE5DEB.description: Recognize the initial letter of one’s first name.

3C873486126D4244988C64FE872AE610.description: GOAL: DEVELOP AN AWARENESS OF THE STRUCTURE OF PRINT

EE7D7297CC534884971BB68A664C3AE5.description:
Represent “in written form,” following an actual
 experience: directions for a recipe or craft or
 scientific observation of events or experiments.

D12AFA246D4846DBBF914334B6190642.description:
Assemble a simple object or craft following
 illustrated directions.

9E4AF3832BAA413295C3ACB8F21CD564.description:
Dictate a description to accompany one’s draw-
 ing of people, objects, events or activities, derived
 from one’s experience or imagination.

D2D0A72F3CAE4718B369299A715DE78B.description:
Represent “in written form” people, objects, events or activities, derived from one’s personal
 experience or imagination.

B8621A9B9B534BE78AE20E9A5E28CF57.description: Use a simplified, illustrated telephone listing.

E551396E796245DFB42D9EB5FEF4B295.description:
Use a simplified, illustrated schedule of activities
 to indicate which activity preceded and which will
 follow an activity.

517D5A0CA047495AAE9DB44CA7631862.description:
Use a simplified schedule of daily activities,
 depicted in pictures and words, to describe the
 order of events for the day, i.e., which are the first
 and last activities.

0A79722276BA478EB5FD939FB5879B15.description:
Collect objects using an illustrated list (pictures
 labeled with words).

C9ADAB31312C496491EEDC521B3970B7.description:
Dictate a simple letter, invitation or thank you
 note.

22DCF3A466824EA192E69FA5856F8BD5.description: Dictate a caption for a drawing or photograph.

81B9488C86E04F22859B124FAD4E0717.description: Identify different examples of print in the environment.

C44502D7DE8740FCB141B608CA37A52B.description:
GOAL: DEVELOP AN AWARENESS OF WRITTEN MATTER/PRINT IN EVERYDAY SURROUNDINGS
AND ITS MANY USES

E59C9F5619B44A7E927E6A7AC2F6714F.description: Emerging Literacy Skills in Reading and Writing

6B954538C3434C2EAC9D455F2364EE96.description:
Point to words that begin with the same letter as
 own first name.

872DF9E89A594111B141DC060B5F3714.description:
Use cover and illustration cues to locate those
 books that pertain to a particular topic or might
 answer a topical question.

6A2DBE2601F04B16A04DF62E7B9A3C05.description:
Point to the title of a book; the top, middle, or bottom of a page; the beginning of a book; where
 to start reading a book; the order that words are
 read on a page; the end of a book; a word; and a
 letter.

C8DE8316713E4DC0BC21ED5381706171.description: Make up and tell a story.

380E219518894AD09146029EE9114EB0.description:
Provide a story ending consistent with other given
 story events.

B392B6C59A354FBF808F20DD99B6062B.description: Predict events in a story, i.e., what will happen next.

D2BDFC58F24849E4B1C74F2F89E7BE68.description:
Attend and listen to books with minimal or no
 illustrations (15 minutes).

3312C2DDA947494181423F1584C85739.description:
Identify previously read books by the title and
 cover.

8DD74D13A120490E9412A7851EEC866C.description: GOAL: DEMONSTRATE AN AWARENESS OF BOOK AND PRINT (WRITTEN LANGUAGE) ORGANIZATION

991FE92663374931B15099912590F39C.description:
“Read”/tell a story based on the illustrations of a
 book with text that has not been read aloud
 previously.

7D5B6DC7D98544C59ED1D85178DB1A55.description: “Read”/tell a story using a wordless picture book.

CA8C0D8659E5474D9A8D5B4BC233763C.description: Sequence illustrations of three to five story events.

CF1BAD04952E4A499D451F1B48C621D5.description: Sequence illustrations of three story events.

6F5CB1550F6C49E6AC729C61EC28D102.description:
“Retell” a story that has been read aloud, Critical
 Skill including character(s), setting (time, place), the
 plot (central idea) of the story, the sequence of
 events and an ending.

8D418FB5DFAA4165A03DB823EA85A2D4.description:
“Retell” a story that has been read aloud, Critical
 Skill including characters, a beginning and an ending.

77E139CC7B74474BA18C460939417B62.description: GOAL: DEVELOP A NOTION OF “STORY SCHEMA”

5425446DF10A417FB01C53A9A3AF1492.description:
Provide or join in repeating the refrain in books
 with repetitive phrases.

3C88FB4FFC3B4875BA3D97664B0B350A.description: GOAL: PARTICIPATE IN STORIES READ ALOUD

75C1832244E44EFE9C31607B51C6C915.description:
Answer who, what, where, when and why Critical
 Skill questions about a read-aloud.

6BC78E33C504439CAA3192565DA9D3C7.description: Answer who, what and where questions about a read-aloud.

29174EB4ED584F6C8BB21F8BCDA974B1.description: Find the illustration, or object within the illustration of a book, that is being described.

E840FFC0F93F4C358ED62BDA1961CC5F.description:
Hold a book correctly, turning the pages in accordance with the story being read aloud, from
 beginning to end.

5393EF2DBA4048D09F168DA747CECE05.description:
Attend and listen to picture books with story lines
 (30 minutes), as well as books of other genres,
 such as nonfiction (15 minutes).

020EBA73C9CE4103A23CE933A10213CA.description:
Attend and listen to illustrated picture books with
 simple story lines.

1F23FA5D3E2E45DC850AE04AF2AA2355.description: GOAL: LISTEN TO STORIES READ ALOUD

7CD467416ECC48808671E02FBFB0AB41.description:
Using familiar rhymes, poems or songs, indicate
 several possible rhyming words (other than those
 included in the actual rhyme) to finish the
 recitation.

1DE9AE08FF124DE395EFBA42872E17B0.description:
Using familiar rhymes, poems or songs, finish a
 recitation that has begun with the correct rhyming
 word.

741B221432E1491A92B14C39A8436287.description: GOAL: DEVELOP A SENSE OF RHYME

9B491D851BCB4F70865E1EF68F015088.description:
Interpret and act out through pantomime a
 nursery rhyme, poem or fingerplay using one’s
 own original gestures and movements.

FBB5F35E6F8742918A732B4C2BA17074.description:
Perform previously taught hand and body gestures associated with a familiar rhyme, poem
 or fingerplay.

DE0C61E8043A49FA9253F4D2FEC00F60.description: With hands and/or feet, clap or tap the beat of a familiar rhyme, poem or finger play.

8EB83DF555974FCD9DE398A167BDED52.description:
GOAL: LISTEN TO NURSERY RHYMES, POEMS, FINGERPLAYS AND SONGS AND RESPOND WITH
APPROPRIATE GESTURES

56BE0AEC7A0E4C609B86CD7A769DA541.description:
Memorize and recite independently a simple
 nursery rhyme, poem or song.

C5C1535E24B9454190AB0B5458310FA6.description: Memorize and recite with others a simple nursery rhyme, poem or song

B800B47927E849DBB01FD87483DC103D.description: Nursery Rhymes, Poems, Fingerplays and Songs

284F5F3630E046DFB9023FE93C91AA4D.description:
Use adverbs, i.e., describing words: quickly, slowly,
 gently, softly, nicely.

E57209633E95420FBD1C556BA1EB3B06.description:
Give a detailed, sequential explanation of how
 to do something so that the activity can be
 carried out by another person.

D27144F437BD436B9F3464160B9404D3.description:
After listening to an oral description of a scene,
 recreate the scene in pictures.

4C467865494E4240B599FC8BDAC01AC7.description:
Use size words: large-small, wide-narrow, big-little, full-empty, tall-short, heavy-light, long-short,
 thick-thin.

2411C0C1CB90487597A20417249F0A30.description: Point to: large-small, wide-narrow, big-little, full-empty, tall-short, heavy-light, long-short, thick-thin.

AADA6CAE4503440AB8F63DED2BF3B8D0.description: Describe oneself, home and immediate family.

26AF9BD6CA4745FC85E61043D7C887E5.description:
Use personal pronouns correctly, especially “I”
 when referring to oneself.

E1E48CD1CC1E437293A6FA409553788D.description:
Understand and use the negative forms of
 declarative sentences, questions and imperatives.

E5A0007A65D54C41AD50B7E5D95B729B.description:
Understand and use increasingly detailed,
 elaborated imperatives

4DCE9A0E5F0F44CB9A7A0E9A1AF08589.description:
Ask or answer increasingly detailed, elaborated
 questions (other than those beginning with who,
 what, where, when, why).

F4653A4446AA4FFD839C4DB4A173D893.description:
Ask or answer questions beginning with: who,
 what, where, when, why.

6C19C5650CBE4E7992EB8ED0F22EBD50.description:
Understand and use complex sentences with
 clauses introduced by: because, if, as soon as, so
 that, while, before, after, who, that, when,
 (verb)+ing.

25DEA6A1DC8E4FC692D10543CECA61A4.description:
Understand and use increasingly detailed,
 elaborated declarative sentences.

082779A48E7046F3AD24995FC0D38C17.description: GOAL: UNDERSTAND AND USE INCREASINGLY VARIED AND COMPLEX VOCABULARY AND SYNTAX

9C58270A32EA4D01A5E83BBA8807F394.description: Use present and past verb tense.

56C9FF730952409CA916177F9039EEF6.description:
Use spatial words: there-here, in-on, in front of-behind, at the top of-at the bottom of, under-
 over, above-below, next to-in the middle of, near-
 far, inside-outside, around-between, up-down,
 high-low, left-right, front-back.

3ED1B87977AF4C94AF2E8CB926636676.description:
Use spatial words: in-out, in front of-behind, at the top of-at the bottom of, under-over, in a
 line/row, up-down.

04D8F305C10A448780EBA1243991AD1B.description:
Show understanding of spatial words: there-here, in-on, in front of-behind, at the top of-at
 the bottom of, under-over, above-below, next to-
 in the middle of, near-far, inside-outside, around-
 between, up-down, high-low, left-right, front-back.

DFE05CFC8C624C4CB787DF4DE91351FF.description:
Demonstrate understanding of spatial words: in-out, in front of-behind, at the top of-at the
 bottom of, under-over, in a line/row, up-down.

1A7809C7F7F2456BBCA159355AF83BB3.description:
Use temporal words: today-tomorrow-yesterday, always-never-sometimes, before-after, now-
 immediate, first-last, beginning-middle-end,
 then-next, already, soon.

890CBFA9911541D28AEA0A2DAED85F3A.description: Use temporal words: today, before-after, now, first-last, day-night, current day, week.

80E9A613B09E4A1C94AE1ABDD1406C7E.description:
Demonstrate understanding of temporal words: today-tomorrow-yesterday, always-never-some-
 times, before-after, now-immediate, first-last,
 beginning-middle-end, then-next, already, soon.

0C766583801B406BA0C82513A28D4698.description:
Demonstrate understanding of temporal words: today, before-after, now, first-last, day-night, cur-
 rent day, week.

4FF9692FA8344F00B0A49265C3C2B480.description: Use sensory attributes: sweet-salty, loud-quiet, hard-soft, rough-smooth, hot-cold, wet-dry.

B12A2D2C2AFA4D05BEE8A74845912209.description: Point to sensory attributes: sweet-salty, loud- quiet, hard-soft, rough-smooth, hot-cold, wet-dry.

8C805389FF354BEEBF22531CAB7982B7.description: Use quantity words: any-some, all-none, more-less (fewer), most-least, many-few, equal, one–ten.

F524E5B7D564498A9082385BF5794ED8.description: Point to: any-some, all-none, more-less (fewer), most-least, many-few, equal, one–ten.

A7A9D376B14F405F99CF8EA933BEEB96.description: Name shapes: circle, square, triangle, rectangle.

394CB4583168418CAB29CFBCE3B6FE78.description: Point to shapes: circle, square, triangle, rectangle.

8B0F2F9B2F404D2FB500937DBC57EB90.description: Point to shapes: circle, square, triangle.

1CB7C6D5C23D4F90ACC7EBA0AE8F8012.description: Name colors: black, blue, brown, green, orange, purple, red, white, yellow.

E99ABE61D17C4CE692D44973BA72961E.description: Point to colors: black, blue, brown, green, orange, purple, red, white, yellow.

6309B22F44954408958132BF101098B5.description: Use increasingly precise verbs related to eating, movement and the five senses.

96D70A13F2394498A5558311CB1A619F.description: Use increasingly precise verbs related to the five senses.

84AC250854B842B0800AF1EF259C67AE.description:
Understand increasingly precise verbs related to
 eating, movement and the five senses.

3C2CB34C72874501A33AE0362A0313A6.description:
Understand increasingly precise verbs related to
 the five senses.

F6368D175AD641CBAB3EFAA39B5F6355.description: GOAL: UNDERSTAND AND USE INCREASINGLY VARIED AND COMPLEX VOCABULARY AND SYNTAX

C384D4C992E342C980888BB217D14786.description:
Name body parts: ankle, arm, back, body, chest, cheek, chin, ear, elbow, eye, eyebrow, eyelash,
 face, finger, foot, forehead, hair, hand, heel, hip,
 knee, leg, lips, mouth, nail, neck, nose, shoulder,
 teeth, toe, tongue, waist, wrist.

EE7B99F0280A41EBA1977C87CCE26199.description:
Name body parts: arm, ear, eye, face, finger, foot, hair, hand, head, leg, mouth, neck, nose, stomach,
 toe.

6E295753033440B1A669ED772743C233.description:
Point to body parts: ankle, arm, back, body, chest, cheek, chin, ear, elbow, eye, eyebrow, eyelash,
 face, finger, foot, forehead, hair, hand, heel, hip,
 knee, leg, lips, mouth, nail, neck, nose, shoulder,
 teeth, toe, tongue, waist, wrist.

BCD59A35CE4F4750BCEB5F984B2DC119.description:
Point to body parts: arm, ear, eye, face, finger, foot, hair, hand, head, leg, mouth, neck, stomach,
 toe.

53C5F01905E14D35A3D849FC2A7AFC0E.description:
Use increasingly precise nouns related to the home, family, food, clothing, school, town/city,
 transportation and stores/services.

042630A4C926456AB57F7B56C68804EB.description: Use increasingly precise nouns related to the home, family and food.

2708374502194C0ABC662647D142D4AB.description:
Point to/understand precise nouns related to the home, family, food, clothing, school, town/city,
 transportation and stores/services.

85CD69BA3853471CA3D6336D689B451E.description: Point to/understand increasingly precise nouns related to the home, family and food.

9526D1EBD74E4889B936B2F4B4FE2E3E.description: GOAL: UNDERSTAND AND USE INCREASINGLY VARIED AND COMPLEX VOCABULARY AND SYNTAX

2337690E578B4863BD8E20DC574AEBC5.description:
Name opposites: big-little, cold-hot, dry-wet, fast-slow, rough-smooth, full-empty, hard-soft,
 large-small, loud-quiet, on-off, open-close, tall-
 short, yes-no.

BF51B5AF671B4CE48133E3BF121EA0F7.description: Pair pictures depicting opposites: big-little, cold- hot, dry-wet, full-empty, happy-sad, open-close.

E7B3B80CF6504D77BA9FE7480D90C09E.description:
GOAL: UNDERSTAND AND USE LANGUAGE TO THINK:
ORGANIZE, RELATE AND ANALYZE INFORMATION

B3144968FED544CAA476F5A8E0BA5207.description:
Assume a different role or perspective and
 express different possibilities, imaginary or
 realistic.

F806D6CAF9AE4189BD3747349E9E7CE1.description: Express a point of view and imagine

44CC2CDCEC0345B3A89D0F95E89C12F7.description: GOAL: UNDERSTAND AND USE LANGUAGE TO COMMUNICATE

C46F84A462E144CEACA28F02A4DCFF67.description: Describe an event or task that will take place.

656C5BB1831D4FF7BA87567A74CAC4BA.description:
Describe an event or task that one has just
 experienced in the immediate past.

459535CE630A41E4AC1FFD955CEA74FF.description:
Describe an event or task that has already taken
 place outside the immediate place and time.

2D599C21BD5B4AEA9F2AB06F0DE98F07.description:
Describe an event or task that one is in the
 process of completing.

ABB8E28190FA401C89F130E6FD022385.description:
Sequence and describe three to five images of events or phases of a single event that have been
 experienced.

7D3BBE5305C7409A87CC345338457E5E.description:
Sequence and describe three images of events or phases of a single event that have been experienced, occurring at temporally distinct times of
 the day

6A9739C7DEE24A609810B4D266B14BE9.description:
Given a picture, individual object or person within
 view, describe the attributes of the object, person
 or picture so that someone else may identify it.

71DD74B73B01480FA9C4543CC20B597E.description:
Given a picture, individual object or person within
 view, indicate the object, person or picture that
 has been designated.

0082D65A37E74D7CB03433187544831D.description:
Identify and express physical sensations, mental states and emotional feelings (happy, sad, angry,
 afraid, frustrated, confused).

2F2A7F09100E46E1AF6E87D6F6EC85A9.description: Express personal needs and desires verbally in a comprehensible manner.

C2745FF4A8F54C7CA0DC24EC0EB90E54.description: Assert state of being, needs and desires

D3A8A8CC93364EC2AB16671F539993DB.description: Carry on a simple conversation on the telephone.

5C0845778C834ACB9B5E728E136C45C0.description:
Carry on a dialogue or conversation with a child of approximately the same age, initiating
 comments or responding to partner’s comments.

68FA8BA40C6A46B5BDC6D41E38950F87.description:
Carry on a dialogue or conversation with an adult, initiating comments or responding to
 partner’s comments.

379F2B0AF811433A95AA7BFB20797FB4.description: GOAL: UNDERSTAND AND USE LANGUAGE TO COMMUNICATE

C5BE7EAF58F64A9982B35471E65309C1.description:
Understand and use intonation and emphasis to
 ask a question or express surprise, agreement,
 displeasure or urgency.

334E0F01450E43F5AEF5FB233FE18281.description:
Adapt the volume of one’s voice to different
 settings and different purposes.

DE03FBFA4E6D4F77B0BFF86A8AFC7BF5.description: GOAL: UNDERSTAND AND USE NONVERBAL FEATURES OF COMMUNICATION
